page.title: 20ASHFORD MEMORIAL HALL
page.content: It was built as a memorial after the 1914_19 war to be used as a village hall for purposes of recreation and education.Responsibility is vested in 5 trustees and run by an elected committee. The snooker_room is still popular in 1985,but it is no longer necessary to provide a daily newspaper for public use since the advent of television.It has been used to extend Ashford Primary School's facilities. The school uses it for School meals every day,games lessons in Winter and concerts when a stage is needed.It provides holiday accommodation for small groups of Brownies and Wolf cubs. The Institute occupies the site of some old thatched cottages and stands on land donated by the Duke of Devonshire.
